044package org.jfree.chart.renderer;
045
046import java.awt.Color;
047import java.awt.Paint;
048import java.io.Serializable;
049
050import org.jfree.chart.HashUtilities;
051import org.jfree.util.PublicCloneable;
052
053/**
054 * A paint scale that returns shades of gray.
055 *
056 * @since 1.0.4
057 */
058public class GrayPaintScale
059        implements PaintScale, PublicCloneable, Serializable {
060
061    /** The lower bound. */
062    private double lowerBound;
063
064    /** The upper bound. */
065    private double upperBound;
066
067    /**
068     * The alpha transparency (0-255).
069     *
070     * @since 1.0.13
071     */
072    private int alpha;
073
074    /**
075     * Creates a new <code>GrayPaintScale</code> instance with default values.
076     */
077    public GrayPaintScale() {
078        this(0.0, 1.0);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Creates a new paint scale for values in the specified range.
083     *
084     * @param lowerBound  the lower bound.
085     * @param upperBound  the upper bound.
086     *
087     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>lowerBound</code> is not
088     *       less than <code>upperBound</code>.
089     */
090    public GrayPaintScale(double lowerBound, double upperBound) {
091        this(lowerBound, upperBound, 255);
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Creates a new paint scale for values in the specified range.
096     *
097     * @param lowerBound  the lower bound.
098     * @param upperBound  the upper bound.
099     * @param alpha  the alpha transparency (0-255).
100     *
101     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>lowerBound</code> is not
102     *       less than <code>upperBound</code>, or <code>alpha</code> is not in
103     *       the range 0 to 255.
104     *
105     * @since 1.0.13
106     */
107    public GrayPaintScale(double lowerBound, double upperBound, int alpha) {
108        if (lowerBound >= upperBound) {
109            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
110                    "Requires lowerBound < upperBound.");
111        }
112        if (alpha < 0 || alpha > 255) {
113            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
114                    "Requires alpha in the range 0 to 255.");
115
116        }
117        this.lowerBound = lowerBound;
118        this.upperBound = upperBound;
119        this.alpha = alpha;
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * Returns the lower bound.
124     *
125     * @return The lower bound.
126     *
127     * @see #getUpperBound()
128     */
129    @Override
130    public double getLowerBound() {
131        return this.lowerBound;
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Returns the upper bound.
136     *
137     * @return The upper bound.
138     *
139     * @see #getLowerBound()
140     */
141    @Override
142    public double getUpperBound() {
143        return this.upperBound;
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Returns the alpha transparency that was specified in the constructor.
148     * 
149     * @return The alpha transparency (in the range 0 to 255).
150     * 
151     * @since 1.0.13
152     */
153    public int getAlpha() {
154        return this.alpha;
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Returns a paint for the specified value.
159     *
160     * @param value  the value (must be within the range specified by the
161     *         lower and upper bounds for the scale).
162     *
163     * @return A paint for the specified value.
164     */
165    @Override
166    public Paint getPaint(double value) {
167        double v = Math.max(value, this.lowerBound);
168        v = Math.min(v, this.upperBound);
169        int g = (int) ((v - this.lowerBound) / (this.upperBound
170                - this.lowerBound) * 255.0);
171        // FIXME:  it probably makes sense to allocate an array of 256 Colors
172        // and lazily populate this array...
173        return new Color(g, g, g, this.alpha);
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Tests this <code>GrayPaintScale</code> instance for equality with an
178     * arbitrary object.  This method returns <code>true</code> if and only
179     * if:
180     * <ul>
181     * <li><code>obj</code> is not <code>null</code>;</li>
182     * <li><code>obj</code> is an instance of <code>GrayPaintScale</code>;</li>
183     * </ul>
184     *
185     * @param obj  the object (<code>null</code> permitted).
186     *
187     * @return A boolean.
188     */
189    @Override
190    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
191        if (obj == this) {
192            return true;
193        }
194        if (!(obj instanceof GrayPaintScale)) {
195            return false;
196        }
197        GrayPaintScale that = (GrayPaintScale) obj;
198        if (this.lowerBound != that.lowerBound) {
199            return false;
200        }
201        if (this.upperBound != that.upperBound) {
202            return false;
203        }
204        if (this.alpha != that.alpha) {
205            return false;
206        }
207        return true;
208    }
209
210    /**
211     * Returns a hash code for this instance.
212     *
213     * @return A hash code.
214     */
215    @Override
216    public int hashCode() {
217        int hash = 7;
218        hash = HashUtilities.hashCode(hash, this.lowerBound);
219        hash = HashUtilities.hashCode(hash, this.upperBound);
220        hash = 43 * hash + this.alpha;
221        return hash;
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Returns a clone of this <code>GrayPaintScale</code> instance.
226     *
227     * @return A clone.
228     *
229     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if there is a problem cloning this
230     *     instance.
231     */
232    @Override
233    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
234        return super.clone();
235    }
236
237}
